template.title: xengallery_watched_album_comment
template.subject: {xen:phrase xengallery_new_comment_added_to_watched_album_y, "albumtitle={$album.titleCensored}"}
template.body_html:
{xen:phrase xengallery_watched_album_comment_html, 'receiver={$receiver.username}', 'replier={$comment.username}', 'board={$xenOptions.boardTitle}'}

{$album.album_title}

 
{xen:raw $comment.messageHtml}
{xen:phrase xengallery_view_this_album} {xen:phrase xengallery_all_watched_albums}

{xen:phrase xengallery_watched_album_email_html_footer_1, 'album={$album.album_title}', 'board={$xenOptions.boardTitle}', 'content=media'}

{xen:phrase xengallery_watched_album_email_html_footer_2, 'watch_link={xen:link canonical:xengallery/albums/watch, $album}', 'manage_link={xen:link canonical:watched/albums/all}', 'disable_this_link={xen:link canonical:watched/via-email, '', 'u={$receiver.user_id}', 'c={$receiver.email_confirm_key}', 'a=no_email', 't=xengallery_album', 'id={$album.album_id}'}', 'disable_all_link={xen:link canonical:watched/via-email, '', 'u={$receiver.user_id}', 'c={$receiver.email_confirm_key}', 'a=no_email'}', 'link_style=color: #969696' }

phrases.phrase:
In strict mode, if node and thread criteria is specified, a wallpaper will strictly display only in the nodes and threads specified, even if other controllers are specified.

In non-strict mode, if thread and node criteria is specified, the wallpaper will still display only in the selected nodes/threads, but also in other controllers.

Options that control the media gallery add-on.
If enabled, the New/Random Media Block will display media from albums (if the viewing user has permission to view those media and albums).
This globally sets the default album add permission.
The maximum number of albums to show per page
Minimum Required Tags for Media in Albums
This allows you to require users to enter at least this many tags when adding media or editing tags on existing media belonging to an album.
This globally sets the default album view permission.
Allow rotating / flipping of animated images

If enabled, and the imagick PECL extension is installed on the server, an animated GIF will be allowed to be rotated/flipped with its animation retained. If you change this value, you will need to rebuild the thumbnails.

If enabled, and the imagick PECL extension is installed on the server, an animated GIF will be thumbnailed and its animation will be maintained. If you change this value, you will need to rebuild the thumbnails.
If enabled, image titles will be populated automatically with the file name of the uploaded file. If disabled, the image titles will be blank and must be filled in.

If enabled,video titles and descriptions will be populated automatically with data fetched from the provided URL (if available). If disabled, the video titles and descriptions will be blank and the title must be filled in.

Choose a category list style. "Classic" lists all categories and their children expanded. "Basic" lists all top level categories and the selected category's parent, siblings and first child. "Collapsible" and "Collapsible Expanded" allow you to expand and collapse each category with the latter having all expanded by default.
In the event that a thumbnail image could not be obtained, the following thumbnail will be used instead.
Use this to specify which EXIF parameters should be fetched during photo uploads.

Use this setting to control where Font Awesome is called. By default, Font Awesome is loaded on every page. You can choose to not load it at all (in which case you will have missing icons unless it is loaded elsewhere in your style).
Show Recent Media on Forum List
If enabled, the recent media list will show on the forum list.

If you choose "Media Only" only the media will be displayed. If you choose "Simple" the media will be displayed with its title. If you choose "Extended" the media will be displayed in posts with additional tabs containing various media information.
List the file extensions that are allowed to be uploaded. Use spaces or line breaks between extensions. This list applies globally to all users and cannot be overridden per user/usergroup.
The maximum number of comments to show per page.
Only show media added within the last X days (Media Home):

If you have a large gallery, your media home page may load slowly. This option will mitigate that to only show media on the media home page from the last X days. Older media is still discoverable via albums, categories and search. Set to 0 for unlimited.
Max number of media items (per page)
The maximum number of media items to show per page.
The media sites you choose here can be used to embed media into the gallery.

Above you can configure where the thumbnails for each media site should be pulled from. If a site isn't configured with a thumbnail, a placeholder image will be used instead. For each media site you can configure a thumbnail URL (use {$id} as a placeholder). Or you can provide a class name if some more advanced code is required to get the thumbnail.
The style selected here will be displayed on all Gallery pages instead of the default style.
Choose the categories you wish to pull media from on the New/Random Media Block.
This number of media items will show in the block.
Either show the most recent media or a random selection
Enable [8wayRun.Com] XenMedio => XenForo Media Gallery Redirection
Enter the name of the import log table you saved when you completed the import. Remember to disable or uninstall the add-on once you have activated redirection.
Enable [xfr] User Albums => XenForo Media Gallery Redirection
Enter the name of the import log table you saved when you completed the import. Remember to disable or uninstall the add-on once you have activated redirection.
Require comment when rating media or album
If checked then all users who wish to rate an album or media item will be required to also write a comment.
Show how many albums in the Recent Albums block in the Gallery sidebar?
Show how many comments in the recent comments block in the Gallery sidebar?
Which locations do you want to display the Gallery Statistics block?
Show how many top contributors in the recent comments block in the Gallery sidebar?
What page should the Media navigation tab link to?

The value here must be a valid phrase in each visitor's language and changing this value will change the word used on the navigation tab from the default "Media" to another one of your choosing. e.g. "home" would change the tab to read "Home".

Changing this option will allow you to adjust the general position of the navigation tab. For finer tuning, you may need to adjust the display order of the XenForo Media Gallery navigation_tab in Code Event Listeners.
Enable member tag approval and delete rejected/pending requests after X days:

Depending on permissions, your members may be allowed to tag others. If this option is enabled, those tags will be subject to the approval of the person being tagged. The person being tagged will receive an alert asking them to approve or reject the request. Pending or rejected requests will be pruned after X days.
When uploading an image, a thumbnail is created based on these dimensions. If you change this value, you will need to rebuild the thumbnails.
When an album is created or updated, this number of media items will be cached and used as a thumbnail for the album.
Enable unviewed media count and cache for X minutes:
If enabled, your members will see a counter above the "Media" tab indicating how many media items there are that haven't yet been viewed.
List the file extensions that are allowed to be uploaded. Use spaces or line breaks between extensions. This list applies globally to all users and cannot be overridden per user/usergroup.
If enabled, an animated GIF will be watermarked.

These are the maximum dimensions for the watermark as a percentage width/height of the original image. The original aspect ratio of the watermark is kept, so the end result is the watermark may be smaller than specified here. This change is not retroactive so you will need to rebuild the watermarks for changes to take effect.
The horizontal and vertical margin in pixels
Set the opacity of your watermark. 100 is opaque.

Various style properties for XenForo Media Gallery
Style properties for XenForo Media Gallery thumbnails
The number of items to display per row on Gallery pages when responsive design is at the "medium" width or below. This helps define the percentage width of each item container.
The number of items to display per row on Gallery pages when responsive design is at the "narrow" width or below. This helps define the percentage width of each item container.
The number of items to display per row on Gallery pages when responsive design is at the "wide" width or below. This helps define the percentage width of each item container.
This field must contain two comma separated values. The first value is the maximum page width. The second value is the number of slides to be displayed at that width.
This field must contain two comma separated values. The first value is the maximum page width. The second value is the number of slides to be displayed at that width.
This field must contain two comma separated values. The first value is the maximum page width. The second value is the number of slides to be displayed at that width.
If enabled, the media title will display on hover. On a touch device, this is automatically forced to show (if enabled). If disabled, no media title is shown.

If enabled you can click left/right to navigate through the block. If disabled, the navigation will not show, but the block can be navigated by clicking and dragging. Navigation never shows on touch devices.
By default, the media information overlay is only visible on hover (or permanently on touch devices). To make the information overlay always visible, enable this option.

If enabled, while hovering over a thumbnail (or using a touch device), a small overlay is displayed that contains extra information such as the uploader, category/album name, and average rating. These details can be toggled on/off below.
Enable media information overlay on hover
This defines the individual items in the responsive container. This enables you to adjust or override the number of items that appear per row on pages without a sidebar (the Find New Media page).

This defines the individual items in the responsive container. This enables you to adjust or override the number of items that appear per row. Forcing a fixed pixel width will allow a dynamic number of items per row, similar to XenForo Media Gallery 1.x.
This is the fluid container that wraps around the responsive elements of media items on the media index pages. The settings here can be useful to mitigate oversized thumbnails on large displays.
Display link to the user's albums page on the member card.
Show link to albums page on user's member card
Display the total number of albums added to the gallery by the message author.
Show author album count on messages
Display link to the user's media page on the member card.
Show link to media page on user's member card
Display the total number of media items added to the gallery by the message author.
Show author media count on messages
This is the width of each slide in the slider. The slides may not be exactly this width due to responsive design resizing them dynamically.
Displays whether the media item is in a category or an album.
Requires "Enable media information overlay on hover" to be enabled.
Display avatar on media info overlay
Requires "Enable media information overlay on hover" to be enabled.
Display media category/album on media info overlay
Displays a count of the number of comments made for the media item.
Displays the date a media item was added, or the date an album was last updated.

Displays a link which opens the media item in the lightbox.
Displays the number of ratings an album or media item has received.

If selected, the media item or album title will be displayed.
In the case of media items, the type of media (image or video) is displayed. For albums, the privacy of the album is displayed.
Requires "Enable media information overlay on hover" to be enabled.
Display media username on media info overlay
Displays the number of views an album or media item has had.

With [xfr] User Albums it is possible to create "global" albums which are public albums that can have content uploaded to by anyone. This is similar to XenForo Media Gallery categories.

If you enable this option, the global albums will be imported as site categories (with no parent and high display order). You may need to re-arrange these as desired after the import is completed.

If you disable this option, the global albums will be imported as public albums and attributed to the original owner.

property.title: Display media/album view count
property.description: Displays the number of views an album or media item has had.

property.title: Category Sidebar
property.description: Controls basic category sidebar functions such as the width.

property.title: Display title in thumbnail container
property.description: If selected, the media item or album title will be displayed.

property.title: Display media username on media info overlay
property.description: Requires "Enable media information overlay on hover" to be enabled.

property.title: Display media/album date icon
property.description: Displays the date a media item was added, or the date an album was last updated.

property.title: Display media comments count
property.description: Displays a count of the number of comments made for the media item.

property.title: Display media category/album on media info overlay
property.description: Requires "Enable media information overlay on hover" to be enabled.

property.title: Display avatar on media info overlay
property.description: Requires "Enable media information overlay on hover" to be enabled.

property.title: Display rating average on media info overlay
property.description: Requires "Enable media information overlay on hover" to be enabled.

property.title: Display media preview icon
property.description: Displays a link which opens the media item in the lightbox.

property.title: Items per row (Wide)
property.description: The number of items to display per row on Gallery pages when responsive design is at the "wide" width or below. This helps define the percentage width of each item container.

property.title: Items per row (Medium)
property.description: The number of items to display per row on Gallery pages when responsive design is at the "medium" width or below. This helps define the percentage width of each item container.

property.title: Items per row (Narrow)
property.description: The number of items to display per row on Gallery pages when responsive design is at the "wide" width or below. This helps define the percentage width of each item container.

property.title: Items per row (Default)
property.description: The default number of items to display per row on Gallery pages. This helps define the percentage width of each item container.

property.title: Enable media information overlay on hover
property.description: If enabled, while hovering over a thumbnail (or using a touch device), a small overlay is displayed that contains extra information such as the uploader, category/album name, and average rating. These details can be toggled on/off below.

property.title: Display description in thumbnail container
property.description: If selected, the media item or album description will be displayed.

property.title: Display media/album likes count
property.description: Displays the number of likes an album or media item has received.

property.title: Display media/albums ratings count
property.description: Displays the number of ratings an album or media item has received.

property.title: Display media/album type icon
property.description: In the case of media items, the type of media (image or video) is displayed. For albums, the privacy of the album is displayed.

property.title: Display album/category indicator icon
property.description: Displays whether the media item is in a category or an album.

property.title: Responsive Container
property.description: This is the fluid container that wraps around the responsive elements of media items on the media index pages. The settings here can be useful to mitigate oversized thumbnails on large displays.

property.title: Responsive Column
property.description: This defines the individual items in the responsive container. This enables you to adjust or override the number of items that appear per row. Forcing a fixed pixel width will allow a dynamic number of items per row, similar to XenForo Media Gallery 1.x.

property.title: Responsive Column (No sidebar)
property.description: This defines the individual items in the responsive container. This enables you to adjust or override the number of items that appear per row on pages without a sidebar (the Find New Media page).

property.title: Enable media title
property.description: If enabled, the media title will display on hover. On a touch device, this is automatically forced to show (if enabled). If disabled, no media title is shown.

property.title: Maximum Slides (Wide)
property.description: This field must contain two comma separated values. The first value is the maximum page width. The second value is the number of slides to be displayed at that width.

property.title: Maximum Slides (Medium)
property.description: This field must contain two comma separated values. The first value is the maximum page width. The second value is the number of slides to be displayed at that width.

property.title: Maximum Slides (Narrow)
property.description: This field must contain two comma separated values. The first value is the maximum page width. The second value is the number of slides to be displayed at that width.

property.title: Enable block navigation links
property.description: If enabled you can click left/right to navigate through the block. If disabled, the navigation will not show, but the block can be navigated by clicking and dragging. Navigation never shows on touch devices.

property.title: Show author media count on messages
property.description: Display the total number of media items added to the gallery by the message author.

property.title: Show author album count on messages
property.description: Display the total number of albums added to the gallery by the message author.

property.title: Show link to albums page on user's member card
property.description: Display link to the user's albums page on the member card.

property.title: Show link to media page on user's member card
property.description: Display link to the user's media page on the member card.

property.title: Media information overlay always visible
property.description: By default, the media information overlay is only visible on hover (or permanently on touch devices). To make the information overlay always visible, enable this option.

property.title: Slide Width
property.description: This is the width of each slide in the slider. The slides may not be exactly this width due to responsive design resizing them dynamically.

group.title: XFMG - Styling
group.description: Various style properties for the XenForo Media Gallery

group.title: XFMG - Thumbnail Elements
group.description: Style properties for the XenForo Media Gallery thumbnails

group.title: XFMG - New Media Block Settings
group.description: Style properties for the forum list new media block

group.title: XFMG - Responsive Design
group.description: Some settings to adjust for responsive design.

group.title: XFMG - Message and Member Card Elements
group.description: Style properties for message user info and member card display

<xen:include template="xengallery_advanced_select.css" />

.inputIconContainer
{
	margin-top: -5px;
}

.inputIconContainer .textCtrl.iconInput
{
	width: 75%!important;
}

.full.textCtrl.iconInput
{
	width: 100%;
}

.inputIconContainer .button.smallButton.toolButton
{
	width: 25px;
	height: 25px;
	line-height: 25px;
	margin: 0px 3px 5px 0;
	padding: 0;
}

.pairsColumns.quotaPairs
{
	font-size: 11px;
}

.editMediaContainer
{
	zoom: 1;
	overflow: hidden;
}

#VideoPreviewArea
{
	min-height: 340px;
	display: none;
}

.VideoPreviewContainer
{
	zoom: 1;
	overflow: hidden;
}

.VideoPreviewSubmitUnit
{
	display: block;
}

.AttachmentEditor,
.VideoPreviewContainer
{
	zoom: 1;
	overflow: hidden;
	clear: both;
}

.AttachmentEditor .AttachedFile
{
	display: none;
}

.AttachmentEditor .AttachedFile .ProgressMeter
{
	display: block;
	padding: 2px;
	border: 1px solid {xen:property primaryLighter};
	border-radius: 4px;
	background-color: {xen:property content.background-color};
	margin-bottom: 5px;
	font-size: 14pt;
	line-height: 26px;
	width: 100%;
	box-sizing: border-box;
}

.AttachmentEditor .AttachedFile .ProgressMeter .ProgressGraphic
{
	display: inline-block;
	width: 0%;
	height: 26px;
	background: {xen:property primaryLight} url('{xen:property imagePath}/xenforo/gradients/category-23px-light.png') repeat-x top;
	text-align: right;
}

.AttachmentEditor .AttachedFile .ProgressMeter .ProgressCounter
{
	display: inline-block;
	height: 26px;
	padding: 0 10px;
}

.AttachmentEditor .AttachedFile .ProgressMeter .ProgressGraphic .ProgressCounter
{
	color: {xen:property primaryLightest};
}

.AttachmentEditor .AttachedFile .AttachmentDeleter,
.AttachmentEditor .AttachedFile .AttachmentCanceller
{
	float: right;
	display: none;
	margin-right: 4px;
}

/* SWFUploader placeholder */

.swfupload
{
	position: absolute;
	z-index: 9997!important;
}

/* Uploader JS Overlay */

.xenOverlay.attachmentUploader
{
	width: 500px;
}

.attachmentUploader #ctrl_upload
{
	margin: 2px auto 5px;
}

.attachmentUploader .attachmentConstraints dl
{
	margin-top: 2px;
	font-size: 11px;
}

.AttachmentList.New
{
	margin-left: 0;
}

.AttachedFilesUnit .submitUnit,
.VideoPreviewSubmitUnit.submitUnit
{
	border-top: none;
}

.itemRow
{
	overflow: hidden;
	zoom: 1;
	margin: 10px 0;
}

.itemRow .Thumbnail
{
	float: left;
}

.collapsed.itemRow .Thumbnail
{
	max-width: 100px;
	transition: all .2s ease-in-out;
}

.expanded.itemRow .Thumbnail
{
	max-width: 180px;
	transition: all .2s ease-in-out;
}

.itemRow .Thumbnail img
{
	max-width: 100%;
	border-radius: 5px;
}

.itemRow .itemFooter
{
	margin-top: 5px;
}

.collapsed.itemRow .itemInputs,
.collapsed.itemRow .itemFooter
{
	margin-left: 105px;
	transition: margin .2s ease-in-out;
}

.expanded.itemRow .itemInputs,
.expanded.itemRow .itemFooter
{
	margin-left: 190px;
	transition: margin .2s ease-in-out;
}

.itemRow .itemInputs .textCtrl
{
	width: 100%;
	max-width: 100%;
	box-sizing: border-box;
	resize: none;
}

.itemRow .itemInputs input.textCtrl
{
	margin-bottom: 4px;
}

.itemRow .itemExtraInput .ctrlUnit.surplusLabel dt label
{
	display: inline-block;
	margin-left: 0;
}

.itemRow .itemExtraInput .ctrlUnit.surplusLabel dt dfn
{
	float: right;
	margin-right: -15px;
}

.leftControls
{
	float: left;
}

.leftControls .item
{
	margin-left: 10px;
	float: left;
	font-size: 11px;
}

.rightControls
{
	float: right;
}

.rightControls .item
{
	margin-right: 10px;
	float: left;
	font-size: 11px;
}

.itemRow .itemFooter .button.AttachmentDeleter:before,
.itemRow .itemFooter .button.DeleteVideo:before
{
	font-size: 1.33333333em;
	line-height: .75em;
	vertical-align: -15%;

	font-family: FontAwesome;
	content: "\f014";
}

.itemRow .itemExtraInput
{
	display: none;
}

.itemRow .itemExtraInput.editPage
{
	display: block;
}

.itemRow .itemExtraInput .fullWidth.surplusLabel dd
{
	width: 100%;
	padding: 0;
	float: left;
}

.itemRow .itemFooter .quotaMessage
{
	margin-top: -4px;
}

.quotaMessage
{
	border: 1px solid {xen:property primaryLighterStill};
	border-radius: 5px;
	font-size: 11px;
	margin: 10px 0;
	padding: 5px;
	line-height: 16px;
	background-image: url('{xen:property imagePath}/xenforo/gradients/form-button-white-25px.png');
}

.quotaMessage dt
{
	color: {xen:property primaryLight};
	display: inline;
}

.quotaMessage dd
{
	color: {xen:property primaryDark};
	display: inline;
}

<xen:if is="{xen:property enableResponsive}">
@media (max-width:{xen:property maxResponsiveMediumWidth})
{
	.Responsive .expanded.itemRow .Thumbnail
	{
		max-width: 100px;
	}
	
	.Responsive .expanded.itemRow .itemInputs,
	.Responsive .expanded.itemRow .itemFooter
	{
		margin-left: 105px;
	}
}

@media (max-width:{xen:property maxResponsiveNarrowWidth})
{
	.Responsive .xenForm .ctrlUnit.chooserUnit > dd
	{
		overflow: visible;
	}
	
	.Responsive .collapsed.itemRow .Thumbnail,
	.Responsive .expanded.itemRow .Thumbnail
	{
		max-width: 75px;
	}
	
	.Responsive .collapsed.itemRow .itemInputs,
	.Responsive .expanded.itemRow .itemInputs,
	.Responsive .collapsed.itemRow .itemFooter,
	.Responsive .expanded.itemRow .itemFooter
	{
		margin-left: 80px;
	}
}
</xen:if>
